name: Albert Einstein: A Biography
description: Patent clerk who bent spacetime — the refugee genius whose equation E=mc² unlocked the atom and whose fame made him the universal symbol of brilliance

name: Charles Darwin: A Biography
description: The man who waited 20 years to publish the most dangerous idea in science — that all life on Earth shares a common ancestor shaped by natural selection

name: Marie Curie: A Biography
description: Two Nobel Prizes, no vote — the woman who discovered radioactivity, drove X-ray trucks to the front lines, and died from the radiation she spent her life studying

name: Alan Turing: A Biography
description: Codebreaker who shortened the war by two years, inventor of the computer, chemically castrated by the country he saved — because he was gay

name: Isaac Newton: A Biography
description: Gravity, calculus, and optics — the vindictive genius who remade physics, ran the Royal Mint, and spent more time on alchemy than on science

name: Galileo Galilei: A Biography
description: The man who pointed a telescope at Jupiter and proved the Church wrong — then spent the rest of his life under house arrest for saying so

name: Nikola Tesla: A Biography
description: The man who invented the electrical grid, lost the credit, and died alone feeding pigeons — while the world ran on his alternating current

name: Rachel Carson: A Biography
description: One book, one scientist, one industry trying to silence her — the marine biologist whose 'Silent Spring' launched the environmental movement
